org.jlinalg.rational

Class Rational

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlinalg.RingElement<RE>
      • org.jlinalg.FieldElement<Rational>
        • org.jlinalg.rational.Rational
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Rational>, IRingElement<Rational>

    public class Rational
extends FieldElement<Rational>
    This class represents a rational number with a numerator and a denominator as BigInteger. The rational number will be kept canceled all the time. Furthermore complex numbers and rational number are compatible in all operations.
    Author:
    Andreas Keilhauer, Simon D. Levy, Georg Thimm
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                   java.math.BigInteger denominator,
                   boolean cancel)

        Parameters:
        numerator -
        denominator -
        cancel - if true, try to cancel the fraction

      • Rational

        protected Rational(double value)
        This creates a Rational out of a double. So for example 1.2 will become 6/5 and Math.PI will become 3141592653589793/1000000000000000.
        Parameters:
        value -

      • Rational

        Parameters:
        number - A string in the format of an integer, integer fraction or exponential notation aka scientific notation) to be converted into a rational.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - if called
